results.title: In the Mind's Eye
results.creator_credit: Emma Buckland, David Blake and Jess Chapkoun
results.brief_description:
The final outcome from a work experience project with Swinburne Unversity of Technology (TAFE) Multimedia Course, Computing and IT Department. “How do you communicate? Do you really listen? Do you respond to what’s been said or do you just talk about your own memory and experience? Dive into “The minds
eye”, a small film that explores what it will take for us to pay attention and react. Directed Written and Produced by Jess Chapkoun, Emma Buckland and David Blake.
Music by Susan Ellis & Stuart Porter and Ivan Rosa & Matthew Farrington

results.title: Democracy forged in a gun barrel
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. “Eureka to me is true Australian grit and courage. It’s about people standing up against injustice and believing in a cause greater than themselves”.

results.title: A discovery of freedom
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. This story is a document of 17 year-old Tom’s experiences in the Eureka 150 youth team. “..I realised that my freedoms and rights were things I had taken for granted”.
results.description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. results.title: Music: the language of us all
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Dominique’s story is about the use of music as the most honest and universal form of free expression.

results.title: The Goldrush had started
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Ben from Alfredton tells the story of his great, great, great, great grandfather who travelled to Australia in search of gold in 1851.
results.description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Ben from Alfredton tells the story of his great, great, great, great grandfather who travelled to Australia in search of gold in 1851.

results.title: Until you break
results.brief_description: Elliot Spencer has exceptional music video skills as well as a distinctive visual style. In this piece he explores the notions of masculinity, community dynamics and success & achievement in a dangerous sport.
results.description: Elliot Spencer has exceptional music video skills as well as a distinctive visual style. In this piece he explores the notions of masculinity, community dynamics and success & achievement in a dangerous sport.

results.title: Screaming red
results.brief_description: WINNER: Diegesis Festival 2003. This well scripted story is painfully easy to relate to with strong character development and use of sound that shows the assurance of a seasoned short filmmaker. Ruthanne describes her film as “A metaphysical journey of the heart, revealing layers of the teenage psyche.”

results.title: Panic time
results.brief_description: This slow build suspenseful short efficiently builds anticipation through a series of very polished point-of-view shots The scene is set with a mysterious girl in an anonymous hotel room.

results.title: Cliche
results.brief_description: “What fears do I have but fear itself? Am I in control? Can the nightmare journey I am on be transcended?” This sophisticated student film shows influences from avant-garde French cinema and features an exceptional original soundtrack.
